title: Lead reserves worldwide by country 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Reserves in million metric tons in the y axis.
The Reserves in million metric tons is highest at Country Australia and lowest at Country Other countries.
The highest Country Australia has 36.0 more Reserves in million metric tons than the lowest Country Other countries.
min_summary: This bar chart has 12 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Reserves in million metric tons in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Reserves in million metric tons 36.0 is found at Country Australia and the minimum is found at Other countries where Country is 0.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Reserves in million metric tons in the y axis.
The Reserves in million metric tons is highest at Country Australia and lowest at Country Other countries.

max_summary: This bar chart has 12 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Reserves in million metric tons in each Country on the y axis.
The Reserves in million metric tons is appeared to be the highest at Country Australia and lowest at Country Other countries.
The second highest Reserves in million metric tons is appeared to be the Country China.
The lowest value at Country Other countries is 3600000000000.0x times less than the highest value at Australia.
Reserves in million metric tons at Country Australia is 36.0 , second place is China at 18.0, and thirdly is Russia at 6.4.
The average Reserves in million metric tons in all 12 Countrys is 7.11.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 85.36.
